page.title: 11WOOLAVINGTON CHURCH
page.content: { Woolavington church }was built by the {Normans}soon after 1085,it reaches a total height of 72 feet.The early records show that the first vicar was called Robert de Schepele (1318-1334). There are six bells in our church which are rung every sunday morning by a team of 15 ringers who practise every friday evening.The{oldest bell {dates back to 1400,the newest 1956. The church will hold about 120 people on the 25 pews.The vicar,Mr Tony Webb has been at the church for 16 months.He is also the vicar for the village of{Cossington.}About 60 people attend the services each week.The choir and organist are at each Sunday service.In the church there is a family service,and a Friday pram service for mothers and their children Funeral,wedding and baptism services are held on request.
